result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abdul Malik Bin Yahya

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered no contact with JBH (DOB: 04/05/1985).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Sworn as Burmese interpreter, Khinma Uddin.

Defendant Abdul Malik Bin Yahya appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Abdul Malik Bin Yahya.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Abdul Malik Bin Yahya
Current: 2828 S 9th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 4601 South 1st Street #103, Milwaukee, WI 53207

Defendant Abdul Malik Bin Yahya not in court. Student Intern Abigail Doweiko in court under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter available by telephone for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/30/22 @ 2:30p
